name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, v. Jeffrey Charles HARMES, Appellant

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, v. Jeffrey Charles HARMES, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: George E. Goldstein, Pottstown, for appellant.
Edward F. Browne, Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
427 A.2d 647
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, v. Jeffrey Charles HARMES, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Jan. 22, 1981.
Decided April 10, 1981.
George E. Goldstein, Pottstown, for appellant.
Edward F. Browne, Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
